name: aMTContaineredTradeProductPackCode
definition: The AMT Containered Trade Product Pack (CTPP) Code uniquely identifies a CTPP within the Australian Medicines Terminology (AMT) ontology. The CTPP represents the marketable medicinal entity available for patient use, with details of the container type. Its attributes include the brand, active ingredient(s), strength(s), form, unit of use quantity and container type.
example: 12345678000012300 – GS1 Paracetamol 500 mg capsule, 20, blister pack

name: pBSFormularyAllocationCode
definition: The National Health Act 1953 provides that listed drugs be assigned to formularies identified as F1 or F2.  Generally F1 is intended for single brand drugs and F2 for drugs that have multiple brands, or are in a therapeutic group with other drugs with multiple brands. Drugs on F2 are subject to the provisions of the Act relating to statutory price reductions, price disclosure and guarantee of supply. Allocation to F1 or F2 is determined by legislative instrument. Single brand combination drugs are not included in either the F1 or F2 formulary.
rationale: Required by Australian Pharmacy Wholesale Industry for continuity of Local Data Synchronisation requirements
businessRuleRationale: Required by Australian Pharmacy Wholesale Industry for continuity of Local Data Synchronisation requirements
validationRules: Will be handled by Validator

name: isTradeItemADangerousGood
definition: Dangerous goods are substances or articles that are potentially dangerous to people, property and the environment. They include materials that are explosive, flammable, spontaneously combustible (burst into flames without being lit), water reactive (produce flammable or toxic gases if mixed with water), oxidizing (help a fire to burn more fiercely), toxic (poisonous), Corrosive.  [Note: this is a Woolworths attribute]
rationale: Woolworths data synchronisation requirements can significantly be met by the current GDSN data set, however there are gaps which need to be met by local AVPs, while submission of a GS1 Australia WR is considered to close these gaps where appropriate.
businessRuleRationale: Required by Woolworths.
validationRules: Will be handled by Validator.

name: isTradeItemAHazardousGood
definition: Hazardous goods are chemicals or chemical compounds that are hazardous to humans and environment. A hazardous substance can be a single chemical or a mixture of two or more chemicals formulated to make a chemical product. They include material that are; Shock sensitivity, Corrosiveness, Oxidising properties, Reactivity with common substances (for example, air or water), Autoignition temperature, Evaporation rate, Vapour density, Odour threshold, PH, at stated concentration, Solubility in organic solvents, Per cent volatiles, Volatile organic compounds, Bulk density.  [Note: this is a Woolworths attribute]
rationale: Woolworths data synchronisation requirements can significantly be met by the current GDSN data set, however there are gaps which need to be met by local AVPs, while submission of a GS1 Australia WR is considered to close these gaps where appropriate.
businessRuleRationale: Required by Woolworths.
validationRules: Will be handled by Validator.

name: manufacturerInternalReference
definition: The internal product number allocated to the product by the original manufacturer of the item. Where the vendor loading GS1net is the manufacturer this field is the same as the Vendor Internal Reference field. Supply at Level: All Applicable
rationale: Required by Australian Industry for continuity of Local Data Synchronisation requirements
businessRuleRationale: Required by Australian Industry for continuity of Local Data Synchronisation requirements

name: nesting
definition: This is the amount that a product will nest into another when stacked. Calculated as the difference between the height (in millimetre) of one product multiplied by 2 and the height of 2 products stacked. Apply at Level: All Applicable Consumer Units
rationale: Required by Australian Industry for continuity of Local Data Synchronisation requirements
businessRuleRationale: Required by Australian Industry for continuity of Local Data Synchronisation requirements
validationRules: Value would be > 0 and Value would be < (Height of product x 2)

name: numberOfBaseUnits
definition: The number of base unit (lowest level) products contained within this product. Only required where item is not a base unit. Supply at Level: All Applicable - Except Base Unitetw.

validationRules: GTIN of Base unit and Number of Base Units are conditionally required

name: optionalNutrientCode

rationale: Required by Australian Industry for continuity of Local Data Synchronisation requirements
businessRuleRationale: Required by Australian Industry for continuity of Local Data Synchronisation requirements
validationRules: Will be handled by Validator

name: palletDepth

businessRuleRationale: Required by Australian Industry for continuity of Local Data Synchronisation requirements

name: palletGrossWeight

businessRuleRationale: Required by Australian Industry for continuity of Local Data Synchronisation requirements

name: palletNetWeight

name: attributePriceType
definition: The definition of the kind of Price this document reflects.One of the following attribute values must be selected from the enumerated list.· List Or Catalogue - The gross price before application of any discounts, allowances, charges, taxes, etcetera. The value represented is the price that the manufacturer expects to receive for the trade item or service from any buyer prior to any relationship specific negotiations (eg, a public catalogue population).· Net Price Calculated by Supplier - The net price after application of any discounts, allowances, charges, taxes, etcetera. It represents the price that the seller expects to receive and the buyer expects to pay considering the relationship that exists between the two parties (eg, data alignment agreement). For example, allowances, charges or price brackets negotiated by either party should be reflected within the value represented in the communication.

name: departementActivite
definition: This attribute is representative of a manufacturer portfolio segmentation, made by the supplier, for grouping products that follow the same Pricing conditions at level 2; each of those segments are given 1 unique code by Cora Belgium that will be used by Cora Belgium to retrieve the pricing structure of a new synchronised product. This codes is communicated by Cora Belgium to the manufacturer when a contract gets agreed by both parties. It is the responsibility of the manufacturer to decide to which pre-defined segment a new product belongs. For instance, a manufacturer selling both frozen and unfrozen foods can decide to have different pricing structures for those 2 sectors, so that each sector would require a specific code. It is the responsibility of the manufacturer, owner of his data products, to decide to which sector a new product will be assigned; and by transmitting the associated code he lets the retailer know which pricing structure is employed.
rationale: Required by Cora Belgium to know which pricing structure applies to a synchronised GTIN
businessRuleRationale: Required by Cora Belgium to know which pricing structure applies to a synchronised GTIN

name: groupeTarifaire

This codes is communicated by Cora Belgium to the manufacturer when a contract gets agreed by both parties. It is the responsibility of the manufacturer to decide to which pre-defined segment a new product belongs. For instance, a manufacturer selling both frozen and unfrozen foods can decide to have different pricing structures for those 2 sectors, so that each sector would require a specific code. It is the responsibility of the manufacturer, owner of his data products, to decide to which sector a new product will be assigned; and by transmitting the associated code he lets the retailer know which pricing structure is employed.<pip
rationale: Required by Cora Belgium to know which pricing structure applies to a synchronised GTIN
businessRuleRationale: Required by Cora Belgium to know which pricing structure applies to a synchronised GTIN

name: BiomedicalHazardType
definition: Biohazard substances pose a threat to the health of living organisms, primarily that of humans.   Biomedical hazards normally come from biological sources or substances used in the diagnosis, prevention, or treatment of diseases.    Having the knowledge of whether a trade item contains biomedical hazards will allow for the item to be handled and administered safely.
rationale: Biohazard Code List: • ANTINEOPLASTIC    Definition: Agents that inhibit or prevent the development, maturation, and proliferation of malignant cells. • BIOLOGIC:  Definition:  A preparation, such as a drug, a vaccine, or an antitoxin, that is synthesized
businessRuleRationale: Biohazard substances pose a threat to the health of living organisms, primarily that of humans. Therefore, it is required to identify if a trade item contains biohazards which are to be handled and administrated safely. There is a need know how to handle
validationRules: The Biomedical Hazard Code must allow multiple selections from the code list.

name: dosageFormType

businessRuleRationale: To provide a description of the products physical form so the user can make the appropriate decisions.

name: extendedTradeItemDateOnPackagingTypeCode
definition: The packaging date types is the date when the goods were packed or produced as determined by the packager.
rationale: It is important to communicate trade item marking indicator with packing or production date to the Data Recipients.  Marking Dates are used in supply chain for decision making such as inventory rotation and pricing. Furthermore, the marking dates are used
businessRuleRationale: None
validationRules: The attribute name according to Fast Track documentation is  extendedTradeItemDateOnPackagingTypeCode if this attribute is duplicated with a different name in GS1 Canada e-AVP, it needs to be removed from there.

name: isDiscountingIllegalInSubdivision
definition: Indicates in which province it is illegal to discount the trade item
example: Provincial Code List: AB – Alberta  BC – British Columbia MB – Manitoba  NB – New Brunswick NF – Newfoundland/Labrador  NS – Nova Scotia NT – Northwest Territories NU – Nunavut  ON – Ontario  PE – Prince Edward Island QC – Quebec SK – Saskatchewan  YK – Y
rationale: The trade item is subject to government regulation regarding either price floors or pricing practices.
businessRuleRationale: None
validationRules: The attribute name according to Fast Track documentation is  isDiscountingIllegalInSubdivision Coumpound attribute. example: TRUE:CA-AB  if this attribute is duplicated with a different name in GS1 Canada e-AVP, it needs to be removed from there

name: isTradeItemDesignedToBeDivisible
definition: Indicates whether the trade item or a single unit may be divided or separated into multiple pre-determined portions.  A fraction or divisible amount of the total quantity of a trade item so as to obtain the desired amount.
rationale: To allow the data providers to communicate if an item can be split or divided into smaller units For a pharmaceutical, a tablet having a minimum of one dividing score mark.  For a food product it may be divided into equal multiple pre-determined portions
businessRuleRationale: Pharmaceutical impact on patient safety. Allows the pharmacist to dispense the correct dose to the patient.  Food service impact to ensure meal portions for special dietary requirements are met for the client/patient.

name: shapeDescriptionFrench
definition: The physical shape of the product defined in French Description de la forme physique - anglais - Français
rationale: To identify the shape the trade item unit is to help distinquish one item from another and accommodate in another lanuage such as French.
businessRuleRationale: To provide the shape information in the French Language

name: temperatureControlRangeCode
definition: Specifies allowed storage and transportation temperature ranges.
example: Temperature Control Range Code List: TCCOL   Cool (8 to 15°C) TCCRT   Controlled room temperature (20 to 25°C) TCEXH   Excessive heat (>40°C) TCFRZ   Frozen (-25 to -20°C) TCNSP   Not Specified TCOTH   OTHER TCREF   Refrigerated (2 to 8°C)
rationale: Trading partners use a list of pre-set temperature ranges the product needs to be maintained at.
businessRuleRationale: Select the appropriate temperature range the item needs to be maintained at from a code list to avoid errors.
validationRules: Allow only one selection

name: tradeItemMarkingsDescriptionEnglish
definition: Describes the distinctive direct marking(s) or imprints on a trade item and the location of the markings as described by the manufacturer in ENGLISH
example: Company Logo on Front, Value with UOM on Back and scored Or  Front Company Logo, Back Value with UOM and scored
rationale: For a product handler/user, it further clarifies or confirms it is the correct product by identifying the manufacturer’s markings.  An example of this is a tool that has a serial number etched into it or a shield of the organization or a size.
businessRuleRationale: In addition to color, size, and shape products are identified and distinguished using a unique marking. These markings can be embossed engraved or printed on the product surface such as front, back or portion of the product that is alternate to the front

name: tradeItemMarkingsDescriptionFrench
definition: Describes the distinctive direct marking(s) or imprints on a trade item and the location of the markings as described by the manufacturer in FRENCH
example: Logo de l’entreprise devant, valeur avec UdM à l’arrière
rationale: For a product handler/user, it further clarifies or confirms it is the correct product by identifying the manufacturer’s markings.  An example of this is a tool that has a serial number etched into it or a shield of the organization or a size.
businessRuleRationale: In addition to color, size, and shape products are identified and distinguished using a unique marking. These markings can be embossed engraved or printed on the product surface such as front, back or portion of the product that is alternate to the front

name: tradeItemregulationTypeCodeControlledDrug
definition: A code indicating the CONTROLLED DRUG type in compliance with specific applicable government regulations.
example: Controlled Drug Code List: CON1 = Controlled Drug Part1 CON2 = Controlled Drug Part2 CON3 = Controlled Drug Part 3 CON4 = Not Applicable
rationale: To comply with the Health Canada Regulations identifing the type of controlled drug and advise the trading partner the status of the product The information is required for handling, storage and reporting to Health Canada, office of Controlled Substances
businessRuleRationale: Identify the correct controlled drug type
validationRules: Allow only one selection

name: tradeItemregulationTypeCodeNarcotic
definition: A code indicating the NARCOTIC type in compliance with specific applicable government regulations.
example: Narcotic Type Code List:     NAR1 Narcotic Only   NAR2 Narcotic Preparation   NAR3 Exempt Codeine    NAR4 Not Applicable
rationale: To comply with the Health Canada Regulations identifing the type of narcotic and advise the trading partner the status of the product The information is required for narcotics handling, storage and reporting to Health Canada, office of Controlled Substanc
businessRuleRationale: Identify the item is a the narcotic drug
validationRules: Allow only one selection

name: tradeItemregulationTypeCodePrecursor
definition: Indicates whether the trade item contains a precursor substance (according to Health Canada) and it's classification. Precursor substances are listed in Schedule VI of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act (Canada).
example: Precursor Code List: A = Class A B = Class B
rationale: The information is required for precursor chemical handling, storage and reporting to Health Canada, office of Controlled Substances
businessRuleRationale: Identify the correct precusor type
validationRules: Allow only one selection

name: tradeItemregulationTypeCodeTargetedSubstance
definition: A code indentifying the trade is a TARGETED DRUG in compliance with specific applicable government regulations.
example: Targeted Code List: TRUE Drug Product Contains Targeted Substance FALSE Drug Product Does Not Contain Targeted Substance.
rationale: To comply with the Health Canada Regulations identifing the trade item is a targeted substance and to advise the trading partner. The information is required for handling, storage and reporting to Health Canada, Office of Controlled Substances
businessRuleRationale: Identify the trade item is a targeted substance.
validationRules: Allow only one selection

name: DQXNonVisualValidation
definition: This attribute is only relevant for DQX service (Data Quality Excellence, GS1 Germany) participants. With the help of this attribute, a visual validation can be actively objected to. If the "true" indicator is not set, a visual inspection will take place for participants of the DQX Service. The cert state AV seal component is assigned regardless of this attribute. The control of whether a company participates is done via a whitelist.
rationale: States whether a participant of the DQX Service would like a visual validation or not. This attribute is only relevant for DQX service participants. With the help of this attribute, a visual validation can actively reject a visual validation from being pe
businessRuleRationale: Extended AVP for Germany's Data Quality Excellence (DQX) program is needed to indicate for consumer units when they are not yet ready for visual validation.

rationale: Used to decribe the clinical size type of DEVICE_SIZE_TEXT_SPECIFY
businessRuleRationale: Group with clinicalSizeType and clincalSizeValue.
validationRules: Mandatory when clinicalSizeType is ""DEVICE_SIZE_TEXT_SPECIFY""

businessRuleRationale: Group with clinicalSizeType2 and clinicalSizeValue2
validationRules: Mandatory when clinicalSizeType is ""DEVICE_SIZE_TEXT_SPECIFY""

definition: When the clinicalSizeType is coded as "DEVICE_SIZE_TEXT_SPECIFY", this is the text used to to denote the dimensional size which is clinically relevant for the use of the trade item by the clinical user.
rationale: Used to describe the clinical size type of DEVICE_SIZE_TEXT_SPECIFY
businessRuleRationale: Group with clinicalSizeType3 and clinicalSizeValue3
validationRules: Mandatory when clinicalSizeType is ""DEVICE_SIZE_TEXT_SPECIFY""

name: clinicalSizeText4

name: directPartMarking
definition: This is a number or marking placed directly on the medical device.

name: doesTradeItemContainHumanTissue
definition: The trade item has, as a component or ingredient, human tissue.  The amount of tissue is not limited to a certain amount, any amount will cause a flag of TRUE.

name: donationIdentificationNumberMarked
definition: Indicates the device is managed by a Donation Identification Number.  This number can be found on the device label or packaging.  The Donation Identification Number is applicable to devices that are also regulated as HCT/Ps and is a number that is assigned to each donation.- Optional, Single Occurrence Boolean, Trading Partner Dependent/Neutral
rationale: To support GUDID requirements

name: exemptFromFDAPreMarketAuthorization
definition: Device is exempt from FDA Premarket regulations.  Premarket approval (PMA) is the FDA process of scientific and regulatory review to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of Class III medical devices. Class III devices are those that support or sustain human life, are of substantial importance in preventing impairment of human health, or which present a potential, unreasonable risk of illness or injury. Due to the level of risk associated with Class III devices, FDA has determined that general and special controls alone are insufficient to assure the safety and effectiveness of class III devices. Therefore, these devices require a premarket approval (PMA) application under section 515 of the FD&C Act in order to obtain marketing clearance. Please note that some Class III preamendment devices may require a Class III 510(k). See "Historical Background2" for additional information.

name: extendedInitialSterilisationPriorToUse
definition: Prior to use, the user should sterilize the item using a method which is not currently available in the GDSN Sterilization Method Code List.  These values are: Chlorine_Dioxide, Dry_Heat, High_Intensity_Or_Pulse_Light, Microwave_Radiation, Sound_Waves, High_Level_Disinfectant, Liquid_Chemical, Nitrogen_Dioxide, and Supercritical_Carbon_Dioxide
example: Chlorine_Dioxide, Dry_Heat, High_Intensity_Or_Pulse_Light, Microwave_Radiation, Sound_Waves, High_Level_Disinfectant, Liquid_Chemical, Nitrogen_Dioxide, and/or Supercritical_Carbon_Dioxide
rationale: This is a temporary attribute until the codes can be placed in final deployment.
businessRuleRationale: This provides the ability to denote other methods of sterilization for the end user which are not readily available in the current GDSN code structure.  These codes have been approved for entry into the GDSN code Structure and once implemented, this attri

name: FDA Preferred Term Code
definition: Unique four-character value assigned by the FDA to indicate a GMDN Preferred Term without exposing the GMDN PT Code.

name: fDAGUDIDPublishDate
definition: The date upon which the Trade Item can be published by the FDA Global Unique Device Identifier Database (FDA GUDID) in their public facing systems.  Until this date, the product information may reside in the FDA GUDID, but will not be visible to the public.  This data is not changeable.
rationale: The FDA GUDID is in need of a publication data to trigger activities in their systems.
businessRuleRationale: The FDA GUDID is in need of a publication data to trigger activities in their systems.

name: fDASupplementNumber
definition: "Number associated with the regulatory decision regarding the applicant’s legal right to market a medical device (PMA Supplement).  After FDA has approved a PMA, an applicant must submit a PMA supplement for review and approval by FDA before making any change affecting the safety or effectiveness of the device unless FDA has advised that an alternate type of submission is permitted for a particular change. All changes must meet the requirements of the Quality System regulation (Good Manufacturing Practices) under 21 CFR Part 820 including the design control requirement under §820.30. Changes for which an applicant must submit a PMA supplement include, but are not limited to, the following types of changes if they affect the safety or effectiveness of the device:  new indication for use of the device; labeling changes; the use of a different facility or establishment to manufacture, process, sterilize, or package the device; changes in manufacturing facilities, methods, or quality control procedures; changes in sterilization procedures; changes in packaging;  changes in the performance or design specifications, circuits, components, ingredients, principles of operation, or physical layout of the device; and extension of the expiration date of the device based on data obtained under a new or revised stability or sterility testing protocol that has not been approved by FDA. [If the protocol has been previously approved by FDA, a supplement is not submitted but the change must be reported to FDA in the postapproval periodic reports as described in the §814.39(b).] "

name: fDAUnitOfUseGTIN
definition: GTIN of a unit of use, as defined by the FDA.  This is a lower level unit which is contained in the Trade Item.
rationale: The FDA requires a unit of use UDI (GTIN) when the Primary DI (Trade item GTIN) has a net content greater than 1.  This attribute will answer this requirement until such time as a permanent solution is derived.
businessRuleRationale: Should only be populated when the Trade Item has a net content of greater than 1.

name: groupedProduct
definition: Code representing if the trade item is considered by the manufacturer to be more than a single item, such as a kit, combination item.
businessRuleRationale: Constrained by the values of KIT, COMBINATION, KIT_AND_COMBINATION
validationRules: Constrained by the values of KIT, COMBINATION, KIT_AND_COMBINATION

name: isTradeItemExemptFromDirectPartMarking
definition: Indicator signifying the trade item is exempt from direct identification marking according to regulation or regulatory filings within the target market.
rationale: Some medical devices are exempt from having specific product identification markings placed on the item itself.  This attributeprovides an indication that the trade item is exempt from Direct Part Marking. This is based on regulations and regulatory filin
businessRuleRationale: None

name: transportationEnvironmentAtmosphericPressMax
definition: The maximum atmospheric pressure in which the item should be transported to remain usable. This value is the value above which the trade item should not be subjected.
businessRuleRationale: Group with the TradeItemTemperatureInformation Class.  Utilizes the UN Recommendation 20 code list for applicable UoM values.
validationRules: Requires the population of transportationEnvironmentAtmosphericPressMaxUoM

name: transportationEnvironmentAtmosphericPressMaxUoM
definition: Unit of measure for the attribute transportationEnvironmentAtmosphericPressMax
businessRuleRationale: Group with the TradeItemTemperatureInformation Class.  Utilizes the UN Recommendation 20 code list for applicable UoM values.
validationRules: Relates to the measurement attribute transportationEnvironmentAtmosphericPressMax

name: transportationEnvironmentAtmosphericPressMin
definition: The minimum atmospheric pressure in which the item should be transported to remain usable. This value is the value below which the trade item should not be subjected.
businessRuleRationale: Group with the TradeItemTemperatureInformation Class.  Utilizes the UN Recommendation 20 code list for applicable UoM values.
validationRules: Requires the population of transportationEnvironmentAtmosphericPressMinUoM

name: transportationEnvironmentAtmosphericPressMinUoM
definition: Unit of measure for the attribute transportationEnvironmentAtmosphericPressMin
businessRuleRationale: Group with the TradeItemTemperatureInformation Class.  Utilizes the UN Recommendation 20 code list for applicable UoM values.
validationRules: Relates to the measurement attribute transportationEnvironmentAtmosphericPressMin

name: transportationHumidityMaximum
definition: The maximum humidity in percentages in which the trade items should be transported.
rationale: To denote the maximum hunidity for the item.
businessRuleRationale: Group with the TradeItemTemperatureInformation Class.  Utilizes the UN Recommendation 20 code list for applicable UoM values.
validationRules: Requires the population of transportationMaximumHumidityMaximumUoM

name: transportationHumidityMaximumUoM
definition: Unit of measure for the attribute transportationMaximumHumidityMaximum
rationale: To denote the maximum humidity for the item.
businessRuleRationale: Group with the TradeItemTemperatureInformation Class.  Utilizes the UN Recommendation 20 code list for applicable UoM values.
validationRules: Relates to the measurement attribute transportationMaximumHumidityMaximum  Value can only be percent

name: transportationHumidityMinimum
definition: The minimum humidity in percentages in which the trade items should be transported.

businessRuleRationale: Group with the TradeItemTemperatureInformation Class.  Utilizes the UN Recommendation 20 code list for applicable UoM values.
validationRules: Requires the population of transportationMinimumHumidityMaximumUoM

name: transportationHumidityMinimumUoM
definition: Unit of measure for the attribute transportationMaximumHumidityMinimum
rationale: To denote the minimum humidity for the item.
businessRuleRationale: Group with the TradeItemTemperatureInformation Class.  Utilizes the UN Recommendation 20 code list for applicable UoM values. ""
validationRules: Relates to the measurement attribute transportationMaximumHumidityMaximum  Value can only be percent""

name: uDIDDeviceCount
definition: The count of medical devices which are contained inside the base item for regulatory purposes.
rationale: Device count is not the same as net content as a single device can contain multiple uses.  The multiple uses would be listed as net content.
businessRuleRationale: This information is part of the UDID regulatory requirements
validationRules: This should only exist at the lowest levels of the hierarchy.

name: paymentDueBasisTypeCode
definition: The basis type on which the payment is due. Use PaymentTermsEventCode to populate.
businessRuleRationale: Adding additional terms to complete the procurement process.

name: discountBaseType
definition: Describes the price base applicable to the discount. Code list values include NET, GROSS.
businessRuleRationale: When there is term, recipeint need to know this for a complete term to integrate these terms to their procurement process

name: netDueTimePeriod
definition: Time period amount should be paid.
businessRuleRationale: When there is term, recipeint need to know this for a complete term to integrate these terms to their procurement process

name: discountApplicablePeriod
definition: Time period the discount is applicable.
businessRuleRationale: When there is term, recipeint need to know this for a complete term to integrate these terms to their procurement process

name: nABCAAdditionalCharges
definition: Any other charges to be added to the Net Cost at FOB point.
rationale: To specify other charges (i.e. Bailment) for product.
businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: If an item is identified as a Bailment item, then this field must be populated.  Provide if applicable.

name: nABCAAddressOfBottler
definition: The address of the entity who bottles the item.
rationale: To specify the address of the bottler
businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: Required.

name: nABCAAddressOfDistiller
definition: The address of the entity who distills the item.
rationale: To specify the address of a supplier.
businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: Required.

name: nABCAAgeVintage
definition: The year or vintage of the beverage. For spirits, value should be provided ##Y or ##M. For wine, value should be provided ####.
rationale: Identifies specific data about product characteristic.
businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: If the product is a spirit then age can be printed but is not required.  If the product is a wine then the vintage/year can be printed, but is not required.

name: nABCAAlternateAgeVintage
definition: The age or vintage of the item as sold under another label. For spirits, value should be provided ##Y or ##M. For wine, value should be provided ####.
rationale: Identifies specific data about product characteristic.
businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: Only populated if nABCAIsSoldUnderAnyOtherLabel is populated.

name: nABCAAlternateLabelExplanation
definition: The explanation of the differences between the item as sold under another label.upp
rationale: To specify why a product is sold under another label.
businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: Only populated if nABCAIsSoldUnderAnyOtherLabel is populated.

name: nABCAAlternatePercentageOfAlcoholByVolume
definition: The proof of the item as sold under another label.
rationale: To specify the percentage of alcohol by volume of a product if it is sold under another label.
businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: Only populated if nABCAIsSoldUnderAnyOtherLabel is populated.

name: nABCABottlerName
definition: An indication of the entity who bottles the item.
rationale: To specify the name of the bottler
businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: Required.

name: nABCADiscountApplied
definition: Any discounts applied to the price of the item.
rationale: To specify any discounts applied to product.
businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: Provide if applicable.

name: nABCAIsImportedItemInbond
definition: An indication if the product is imported and whether the product is being admitted into the US provisionally without payment or duties.
rationale: To specify whether a product that is imported is inbond or not.
businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: If product is imported, then this field should be populated, but it is not required.

name: nABCAIsSoldUnderAnyOtherLabel

rationale: To specify whether the address can be sold under another label.
businessRuleRationale: N/A

name: nABCAItemFOBPoint
definition: Point at which the item is legally the property of the purchaser.

businessRuleRationale: N/A

name: nABCAItemShipPoint

businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: Required.

name: nABCAMarineInsurance

businessRuleRationale: N/A

name: nABCANetCostFOBShipPoint
definition: Cost of the item at the freight on board point, without any shipping charges, bailment charges, or any discounts appliedcom/

businessRuleRationale: N/A

name: nABCAOceanFreight

businessRuleRationale: N/A

name: nABCAOrderType
definition: Products are either State Stock (SS), Bailment (BO), or Special Purchase Order Plan (SP). State Stock items are stocked by the state. Bailment items are when a state rents space in a warehouse and the supplier pays a fee to store the items there. Special Purchase Order Plan indicates whether the item is a special listing. This attribute identifes which of these three order types is appropriate.
rationale: To specify restrictions/conditions (such as shipping; ordering)
businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: Can only be populated with one of the three options: BO, SS, SP.  Required.

name: nABCAPriceRemarks
definition: Any remarks associated with the case price and/or the difference in the current price compared to the previous price.s
example: This is an increase due to increase in production costs.
rationale: To specify any remarks regarding price changes.
businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: Provide if applicable.

name: nABCAPricingTerms
definition: The terms that the state agreed to pay for the product.
rationale: To specify how the state agreed to pay for product.
businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: Required.

name: nABCARepresentativeForTheStateAddress

validationRules: Required

name: nABCARepresentativeForTheStateFax

validationRules: Required.

name: nABCARepresentativeForTheStateLicenseNumber

name: nABCARepresentativeForTheStateName

example: Montgomery Beverage Company dba Alliance Spirits & Wine; LLC

businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: Field must be populated

name: nABCARepresentativeForTheStateTelephone
definition: Telephone number of State Representative
rationale: To specify the state representative's phone number.
businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: Required.

name: nABCASupplierAddress
definition: Supplier's Address
rationale: To specify the supplier's address.
businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: Required.

name: nABCASupplierFax
definition: Supplier's fax number
rationale: To specify the supplier's fax number
businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: Required

name: nABCASupplierFederalIDNumber
definition: Supplier's Federal Identification Number
rationale: To specify the supplier's federal ID number.
businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: Required.

name: nABCASupplierStateLicensePermitNumber
definition: Supplier's state license or permit number.
rationale: To specify the supplier's license/permit number in state.
businessRuleRationale: N/A
validationRules: Required.

name: nutrientRelevantDataProvided
definition: Nutrient Information is populated for those values which are relevant or required to be populated on the product label or label equivalent.  All values not populated are not relevant or not required to be populated on the product label by local regulations.
rationale: Data recipients need to be able to determine when all allergen and nutrient information has been populated, specifically when one or more or  the values are not populated as they are not relevant or not required to be populated Example- Leaving a value bl
businessRuleRationale: Data recipients need to be able to determine when all allergen and nutrient information has been populated, specifically when one or more or  the values are not populated as they are not relevant or not required to be populated Example- Leaving a value bl

name: nutrientValueDerivation
definition: The derivation of the values, percent of intake and quantity contained, provided in the nutrient class.
rationale: To assist users of the data in determining the source of the information
businessRuleRationale: To assist users of the data in determining the source of the information
validationRules: Valid values are:• Analytical- The item’s nutrient values have been determined through direct scientific analysis by a lab.   • Calculated- The item’s nutrient values have been determined through a calculation of nutrient values provided for its ingredien

name: servingSizeWeight
definition: The gram weight for the recommended serving size.
rationale: This will allow menu planning systems to derive serving sizes which can be used in recipes, specifically wheremultiple items arejoined together to form a new menu item.
businessRuleRationale: This is a temporary attribute until GDSN can deploy the change to make servingSize allow multiple occurrences
validationRules: Only needs to be provided if servingSize is not in grams.

name: servingsPerPackage
definition: The approximate number of servings contained in the package.  This is an integer denoting the servings, however according to FDA/USDA labeling regulations, the value can contain provide half servings between 1 and 6 servings.  For example the value can be 2.5, but can not be 10.5.
rationale: Allows users to understand how many servings to expect from the trade item.
businessRuleRationale: Allows users to understand how many servings to expect from the trade item.
validationRules: Value must be a whole number if the value is greater than or equal to 6.  Values less than 6, must be any of these values 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4, 4.5, 5, or 5.5.

name: milkProducts
definition: Characterisation (specification, differentiation) of the product on milk basis (for the German target market according to § 2 no. 7 Milk Act).

name: consumerUsageCode
definition: A code representation of the A.I.S.E. Safe use icon marked on the package. A.I.S.E., the International Association for Soaps, Detergents and Maintenance Products, has developed a set of safe use icons in order to improve and further develop clear messages for consumers on how to use A.I.S.E. consumer products. These messages have been communicated via on-pack labelling and other communication tools since 2004. They are made freely available by A.I.S.E. to any company placing soaps, detergents or maintenance products on the EU market, provided the use of these icons/messages complies with the A.I.S.E. legal and technical guidelines, see http://www.aise.eu .
rationale: Hinweis: Zusätzliches alternatives Inbound Mapping für die Ablösung des APVs durch das Standardattribut mit einem späteren Release. Das Outbound Mapping bleibt zurzeit unverändert.  | Additional alternative inbound mapping for the replacement of the AVP by the standard attribute in a future release. Outbound mapping remains unchanged for the time being.:

name: itemFlagSample
definition: Product characteristics of the cosmetic product, e. g. sample, tester, recency.
validationRules: consumer_instructions:consumerInstructionsModule/consumerInstructions/consumerUsageLabelCode/enumerationValueInformation/enumerationValue

name: volumeOfAlcoholInGVOCWeight
definition: Ingredient solvent in gram.

name: volumeOfAlcoholInVOCPerCent
definition: Ingredient solvent in percent.
validationRules: consumer_instructions:consumerInstructionsModule/consumerInstructions/consumerUsageLabelCode/externalAgencyName = AISE

name: subgroupEDT
definition: Product subgroup the product can be assigned to, e.g. Eau de Toilette, Eau de Parfum …(EDT, EDP, EDS, PDC etc.)

name: gTINofSetComponent
definition: GTIN of the contained component in the set.

name: marketingTextShortTextTeaser
definition: Enhanced marketing or teaser text.

name: freeTextModeOfAdministration
definition: Mode of administration as free text.

name: Certification Standard Year of Issue
definition: The Year of Issue of the certification standard.
rationale: Needed by business
businessRuleRationale: If the product packaging (label) displays the Year of Issue of the certification standard, this attribute is MANDATORY.

name: Additional Certification Standard Description
definition: Additional description of the certification standard.
rationale: Needed by business
businessRuleRationale: If the product packaging (label) displays additional description of the certification standard, this attribute is MANDATORY.

name: materialSafetyDataSheetLastUpdateDate
definition: Date on which the safety data sheet or risk sheet was created or modified.

name: mainComponent
definition: Specifies the main (hazardous) chemical component or material of the product (e.g. wooden garden furniture). Allows the ICPE heading to be deducted for non-hazardous products. Example: Wood

name: gHSClassificationStatement
definition:
The CLP class corresponds to the nature of the physical, health or environmental hazard. The CLP hazard category is the division of the criteria within each hazard class specifying the severity of the hazard._x000d_
This information appears to be the minimum data for the ecommerce.

name: extendedImportClassification
definition: Allows the indication of any type of additional customs nomenclature. In France, the need is to indicate the European excise product code and the French excise product code.

name: incentiveUnitBasisTradeItemInformation
definition: The unit basis used to calculate incentive points for a quantity discount on the declared business unit.

name: fiscalDescriptionCode
definition:
New data associated with alcoholic beverages appeared with the implementation of C.I.E.L (Contributions Indirectes En Ligne) for the dematerialization of the main tax declarations in the field of indirect taxes._x000d_
_x000d_
The decree of March 26, 2018 provides for the mandatory use of online declaration and payment of duties by:_x000d_
September 1, 2019 for wine producers (harvesters-winemakers, traders-winemakers and cooperative wineries) ;_x000d_
December 31, 2019 for other operators in the indirect tax sector._x000d_
_x000d_
